newsitem.title: USA: Texaco sees US downstream deal closing 1998.
newsitem.headline: Texaco sees US downstream deal closing 1998.

text.p: A Texaco Inc spokesman said the company expected its three-way U.S. refining merger with Shell Oil Co and Saudi Refining Inc to close in early 1998.
"That's right, we expect this to close in early 1998," said Texaco spokesman Jim Swords.
Shell and Texaco on Tuesday announced they had signed a memorandum of understanding to combine their midwestern and western U.S. refining and marketing operations.

The companies also are in talks on combining their eastern U.S. operations in a deal with Saudi Refining Inc, a joint venture of Texaco and state-owned Saudi Aramco. An agreement on that segment of the deal is expected in the second quarter 1997, the companies said.
